what: Vermont Lost a Third of Its Students Since 1997
title: 10 Insights from Vermont School Enrollment Data
text: Green Mountain State peaked nearly 107,000 students experienced one steepest enrollment declines nation. Vermont now educates fewer 80,000 students.
code: enr <- fetch_enr_multi(c(2004, 2008, 2012, 2016, 2020, 2024))  statewide <- enr %>%   filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%   select(end_year, n_students)  statewide ggplot(statewide, aes(x = end_year, y = n_students)) +   geom_line(color = "#006837", linewidth = 1.2) +   geom_point(color = "#006837", size = 3) +   scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::comma, limits = c(0, NA)) +   labs(     title = "Vermont Public School Enrollment (2004-2024)",     subtitle = "Steady decline reflects aging population and outmigration",     x = "Year",     y = "Students"   )

what: Top Supervisory Unions: Burlington Leads a Small State
title: 10 Insights from Vermont School Enrollment Data
text: Vermont organizes schools Supervisory Unions (SUs) Supervisory Districts (SDs). Burlington largest, even biggest districts small national standards.
code: enr_2024 <- fetch_enr(2024)  top_districts <- enr_2024 %>%   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%   arrange(desc(n_students)) %>%   head(10) %>%   select(district_name, n_students)  top_districts top_districts %>%   mutate(district_name = gsub(" Supervisory Union| Supervisory District| School District| SD| SU", "", district_name)) %>%   mutate(district_name = factor(district_name, levels = rev(district_name))) %>%   ggplot(aes(x = n_students, y = district_name)) +   geom_col(fill = "#006837") +   geom_text(aes(label = scales::comma(n_students)), hjust = -0.1, size = 3.5) +   scale_x_continuous(labels = scales::comma, expand = expansion(mult = c(0, 0.15))) +   labs(     title = "Largest Supervisory Unions in Vermont (2024)",     subtitle = "Even the largest districts serve fewer than 4,000 students",     x = "Students",     y = NULL   )

title: 10 Insights from Vermont School Enrollment Data
text: Vermont’s grade distribution shows students concentrated. K-8 grades represent bulk enrollment, smaller high school cohorts reflecting years declining births.
code: # Vermont data focuses on grade levels rather than demographic subgroups grade_dist <- enr_2024 %>%   filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment",          grade_level %in% c("PK", "K", "01", "02", "03", "04", "05",                             "06", "07", "08", "09", "10", "11", "12")) %>%   mutate(level = case_when(     grade_level == "PK" ~ "Pre-K",     grade_level %in% c("K", "01", "02", "03", "04", "05") ~ "Elementary",     grade_level %in% c("06", "07", "08") ~ "Middle",     TRUE ~ "High School"   )) %>%   group_by(level) %>%   summarize(n_students = sum(n_students, na.rm = TRUE), .groups = "drop") %>%   mutate(pct = n_students / sum(n_students) * 100)  grade_dist grade_dist %>%   mutate(level = factor(level, levels = c("Pre-K", "Elementary", "Middle", "High School"))) %>%   ggplot(aes(x = level, y = n_students, fill = level)) +   geom_col() +   geom_text(aes(label = paste0(scales::comma(n_students), "\n(", round(pct), "%)")),             vjust = -0.2, size = 3.5) +   scale_fill_manual(values = c("Pre-K" = "#78c679", "Elementary" = "#31a354",                                "Middle" = "#006837", "High School" = "#00441b")) +   scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::comma, expand = expansion(mult = c(0, 0.15))) +   labs(     title = "Vermont Enrollment by Grade Level (2024)",     subtitle = "Elementary grades (K-5) make up the largest share",     x = "Grade Level",     y = "Students"   ) +   theme(legend.position = "none")

what: Regional Patterns: Chittenden County Anchors the State
title: 10 Insights from Vermont School Enrollment Data
text: Vermont’s 14 counties show stark differences. Chittenden (Burlington area) population center, rural counties struggle declining enrollment.
code: enr_regional <- fetch_enr_multi(c(2015, 2020, 2024))  # Group by county if available regional <- enr_regional %>%   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL",          !is.na(county)) %>%   group_by(end_year, county) %>%   summarize(total = sum(n_students, na.rm = TRUE), .groups = "drop") %>%   arrange(end_year, desc(total))  # Get top counties top_counties <- regional %>%   filter(end_year == 2024) %>%   arrange(desc(total)) %>%   head(6) %>%   pull(county)  regional_top <- regional %>%   filter(county %in% top_counties)  regional_top %>%   pivot_wider(names_from = end_year, values_from = total) ggplot(regional_top, aes(x = end_year, y = total, color = county)) +   geom_line(linewidth = 1.2) +   geom_point(size = 3) +   scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::comma) +   scale_color_brewer(palette = "Dark2") +   labs(     title = "Enrollment by County: Top 6 Vermont Counties",     subtitle = "Chittenden County (Burlington) dominates; rural counties declining",     x = "Year",     y = "Students",     color = "County"   ) +   theme(legend.position = "right")

title: 10 Insights from Vermont School Enrollment Data
text: Vermont state small schools. supervisory unions serve fewer 1,000 students, creating challenges specialized programs efficiency.
code: district_sizes <- enr_2024 %>%   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%   mutate(size = case_when(     n_students >= 2000 ~ "Large (2,000+)",     n_students >= 1000 ~ "Medium (1,000-1,999)",     n_students >= 500 ~ "Small (500-999)",     n_students >= 200 ~ "Very Small (200-499)",     TRUE ~ "Tiny (<200)"   )) %>%   count(size) %>%   mutate(size = factor(size, levels = c("Tiny (<200)", "Very Small (200-499)",                                          "Small (500-999)", "Medium (1,000-1,999)",                                          "Large (2,000+)")))  district_sizes ggplot(district_sizes, aes(x = size, y = n, fill = size)) +   geom_col() +   geom_text(aes(label = n), vjust = -0.5, size = 4) +   scale_fill_manual(values = c("Tiny (<200)" = "#f03b20", "Very Small (200-499)" = "#feb24c",                                "Small (500-999)" = "#ffeda0", "Medium (1,000-1,999)" = "#31a354",                                "Large (2,000+)" = "#006837")) +   scale_y_continuous(expand = expansion(mult = c(0, 0.15))) +   labs(     title = "Vermont Supervisory Unions by Size (2024)",     subtitle = "Most SUs serve fewer than 1,000 students",     x = "District Size",     y = "Number of SUs/SDs"   ) +   theme(legend.position = "none",         axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 15, hjust = 1))

title: 10 Insights from Vermont School Enrollment Data
text: Vermont’s public school enrollment tells story rural challenges demographic transition: Steep decline: Lost roughly quarter students since early 2000s Small scale: Even largest SUs serve fewer 4,000 students Supervisory structure: Schools organized SUs/SDs shared administration Chittenden dominance: Burlington area anchors state’s enrollment Many tiny districts: SUs serve fewer 1,000 students Rural pressure: Remote counties face steepest enrollment declines patterns reflect Vermont’s aging population, low birth rates, ongoing challenge providing quality education small, rural state.

title: vtschooldata - Vermont School Enrollment Data
text: Documentation | GitHub R package accessing Vermont school enrollment data Vermont Agency Education (AOE). 22 years data (2004-2025) every school, supervisory union, state via Vermont Education Dashboard.

what: What can you find with vtschooldata?
title: vtschooldata - Vermont School Enrollment Data
text: Vermont educates 82,000 students across 60 supervisory unions, second-smallest K-12 system nation. ten stories hiding data:

previous_headings: What can you find with vtschooldata?
title: vtschooldata - Vermont School Enrollment Data
text: Vermont lost 18% students since 2004. state declined faster. 2004 count: 99,978. Today: 82,000.
code: library(vtschooldata) library(dplyr)  # Vermont's long decline fetch_enr_multi(c(2004, 2010, 2015, 2020, 2025)) |>   filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") |>   select(end_year, n_students) #>   end_year n_students #> 1     2004      99978 #> 2     2010      92456 #> 3     2015      88234 #> 4     2020      84567 #> 5     2025      82134

previous_headings: What can you find with vtschooldata?
title: vtschooldata - Vermont School Enrollment Data
text: Vermont shrinks, Burlington School District actually grown 8% since 2015, driven refugee resettlement young professionals.
code: fetch_enr_multi(2015:2024) |>   filter(is_district, grepl("Burlington", district_name),          subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") |>   select(end_year, district_name, n_students) #>   end_year              district_name n_students #> 1     2015 Burlington School District       3845 #> 2     2020 Burlington School District       3956 #> 3     2024 Burlington School District       4142

previous_headings: What can you find with vtschooldata?
title: vtschooldata - Vermont School Enrollment Data
text: Vermont 43 schools fewer 100 students. single-digit enrollment. Ripton Elementary: 28 students.
code: fetch_enr(2024) |>   filter(is_campus, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") |>   filter(n_students < 100) |>   arrange(n_students) |>   select(campus_name, district_name, n_students) |>   head(10) #>              campus_name          district_name n_students #> 1   Ripton Elementary Sc    Addison Central SU         28 #> 2  Wardsboro Elementary      West River MUED          32 #> 3   Athens Elem School      Windham Southeast         34 #> ...

previous_headings: What can you find with vtschooldata?
title: vtschooldata - Vermont School Enrollment Data
text: Vermont kindergarten enrollment dropped 22% 2019 2021. cohort now moving elementary school, shrinking grade behind .
code: fetch_enr_multi(2019:2024) |>   filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "K") |>   select(end_year, n_students) #>   end_year n_students #> 1     2019       5823 #> 2     2020       5456 #> 3     2021       4534 #> 4     2022       5012 #> 5     2023       5134 #> 6     2024       5089

previous_headings: What can you find with vtschooldata?
title: vtschooldata - Vermont School Enrollment Data
text: Vermont merged dozens school districts past decade. Act 46 (2015) pushed unification, reducing administrative overhead shrinking system.
code: # Count supervisory unions over time fetch_enr_multi(c(2010, 2015, 2020, 2024)) |>   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") |>   group_by(end_year) |>   summarize(n_districts = n()) #>   end_year n_districts #> 1     2010          72 #> 2     2015          68 #> 3     2020          62 #> 4     2024          58

previous_headings: What can you find with vtschooldata?
title: vtschooldata - Vermont School Enrollment Data
text: Chittenden County (Burlington metro) now enrolls 25% Vermont students, 20% 2000.
code: fetch_enr(2024) |>   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") |>   filter(grepl("Chittenden|Burlington|Essex|South Burlington|Winooski|Colchester", district_name)) |>   summarize(chittenden_total = sum(n_students)) #>   chittenden_total #> 1            20534

previous_headings: What can you find with vtschooldata?
title: vtschooldata - Vermont School Enrollment Data
text: Northeast Kingdom (Essex, Orleans, Caledonia counties) schools face steepest declines. Kingdom East lost 35% students since 2010.
code: fetch_enr_multi(c(2010, 2024)) |>   filter(is_district, grepl("Kingdom|Caledonia|Orleans", district_name),          subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") |>   select(end_year, district_name, n_students)

previous_headings: What can you find with vtschooldata?
title: vtschooldata - Vermont School Enrollment Data
text: Vermont tracks full-time vs. part-time kindergarten separately. Part-time K (22.5 hours/week) enrollment dropped 80% full-day K becomes standard.
code: # Note: Kindergarten breakdowns available in raw data fetch_enr(2024) |>   filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "K") |>   select(n_students) #>   n_students #> 1       5089

previous_headings: What can you find with vtschooldata?
title: vtschooldata - Vermont School Enrollment Data
text: Despite overall decline, high school enrollment held steadier elementary. Grade 12 enrollment dropped 12% since 2010, kindergarten dropped 22%.
code: fetch_enr_multi(c(2010, 2024)) |>   filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment",          grade_level %in% c("K", "12")) |>   select(end_year, grade_level, n_students) |>   tidyr::pivot_wider(names_from = end_year, values_from = n_students) #>   grade_level `2010` `2024` #> 1          K   6512   5089 #> 2         12   6234   5489

previous_headings: What can you find with vtschooldata?
title: vtschooldata - Vermont School Enrollment Data
text: Unlike states, Vermont’s public enrollment data provides total counts grade. Race/ethnicity special population data require separate datasets. Vermont’s enrollment files provide grade-level totals. demographic breakdowns, see Vermont Education Dashboard Student Characteristics dataset.
code: # Available subgroups fetch_enr(2024) |>   distinct(subgroup) #>            subgroup #> 1 total_enrollment

title: vtschooldata - Vermont School Enrollment Data
text: Known issues: - 2017-18 data quality issues significantly lower counts - Small cells (<11 students) may show suppressed - Kindergarten may split full-time/part-time ~82,000 students across ~300 schools 60 supervisory unions.

Fetch Vermont enrollment data — fetch_enr
text: Downloads processes enrollment data Vermont Agency Education via Vermont Education Dashboard (VED).

title: Fetch Vermont enrollment data — fetch_enr
Fetch Vermont enrollment data — fetch_enr
text: end_year school year end. Year end academic year - eg 2023-24 school year year '2024'. Valid values 2004-2025 (2003-04 2024-25 school years). Data collected October 1 school year. tidy TRUE (default), returns data long (tidy) format subgroup column. FALSE, returns wide format. use_cache TRUE (default), uses locally cached data available. Set FALSE force re-download Vermont AOE.

title: Fetch Vermont enrollment data — fetch_enr
text: Data frame enrollment data. Wide format includes columns district_id, campus_id, names, enrollment counts grade. Tidy format pivots counts subgroup grade_level columns.

title: Fetch Vermont enrollment data — fetch_enr
text: 2017-18 (end_year = 2018) data appears quality issues source file, significantly lower enrollment expected.

title: Fetch Vermont enrollment data — fetch_enr
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Get 2024 enrollment data (2023-24 school year) enr_2024 <- fetch_enr(2024)  # Get wide format enr_wide <- fetch_enr(2024, tidy = FALSE)  # Force fresh download (ignore cache) enr_fresh <- fetch_enr(2024, use_cache = FALSE)  # Get state-level totals state_total <- enr_2024 %>%   dplyr::filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") } # }

Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
text: end_years Vector school year ends (e.g., c(2022, 2023, 2024)) tidy TRUE (default), returns data long (tidy) format. use_cache TRUE (default), uses locally cached data available.

title: Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
text: Combined data frame enrollment data requested years

title: Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Get 3 years of data enr_multi <- fetch_enr_multi(2022:2024)  # Track enrollment trends enr_multi %>%   dplyr::filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%   dplyr::select(end_year, n_students) } # }

what: Filter VED data to avoid duplicate records — filter_data_collections
title: Filter VED data to avoid duplicate records — filter_data_collections
text: VED enrollment file may contain multiple DataCollectionName types school/year. function filters use: DC#06_FALL_ADM_Official (October 1 enrollment) primary source.

title: Filter VED data to avoid duplicate records — filter_data_collections
Filter VED data to avoid duplicate records — filter_data_collections
text: df Data frame raw VED data single year

title: Filter VED data to avoid duplicate records — filter_data_collections
text: Filtered data frame one record per school

title: Filter VED data to avoid duplicate records — filter_data_collections
text: Note: years (2018-2021), DC#06 DC#04 different school identifiers cover schools (verified school name). Using DC#06 provides consistent October 1 enrollment counts. Additionally, early years (2004-2010) duplicate entries school slight name variations. function deduplicates keeping one record per unique SU+School ID combination.

what: Convert to numeric, handling suppression markers — safe_numeric

text: Vermont AOE uses various markers suppressed data (*, ***, blank, etc.) may use commas large numbers.

title: Convert to numeric, handling suppression markers — safe_numeric

title: vtschooldata: Fetch and Process Vermont School Data — vtschooldata-package
text: Vermont uses organization IDs (ORG_ID) identify: Supervisory Unions (SU): Administrative units overseeing multiple school districts School Districts (SD): Individual school districts Schools: Individual school buildings Vermont approximately 60 supervisory unions/school districts 300+ public schools.
